definition: to hook onto/to hitch onto/to catch onto
to hook/to sew/to crochet/hook/check mark or tick/window catch
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.english: Her skirt got caught on a nail.
sentences.chinese: 她的裙边给钉子钩住了。

sentences.english: Please help me, my coat hitches on something.
sentences.chinese: 帮我个忙，我的衣服被什么给钩住了。

sentences.english: The edge of her skirt caught on a nail.
sentences.chinese: 她的裙边给钉子钩住了。

sentences.english: The bigger ones get hooked with a special gaff.
sentences.chinese: 大鱼就用特制的鱼钩钩住。

sentences.english: My skirt caught on a nail.
sentences.chinese: 人的裙女被钉女钩住了。

sentences.english: People often refer to being "hooked on TV."
sentences.chinese: 人们经常说被“电视钩住”了。

sentences.english: My coat caught on the nail.
sentences.chinese: 我的大衣被钉子钩住了。

sentences.english: I caught the pocket of my coat on a nail; it's nearly torn off.
sentences.chinese: 我的上衣口袋给钉子钩住，差点儿给撕下来。

sentences.english: The car on the bottom of the lake was hooked in and hoisted on to the bank.
sentences.chinese: 那辆跌入湖底的汽车，用钩子钩住后吊到了岸上。

sentences.english: ANCHOR】The anchor caught in the mud of the lake bottom and kept the boat from moving.
sentences.chinese: 锚钩住湖底的泥巴，使船不致移动。

sentences.english: Use limitation to be in in shuttle root B by the needlework annulus of shuttle sharp hook outward surge.
sentences.chinese: 用来限制被梭尖钩住的针线环在梭根B处向外滑脱。

sentences.english: The brave captain grappled with the enemy's ships and boarded them.
sentences.chinese: 那勇敢的船长用铁钩钩住敌船，随后登船攻击。

sentences.english: His coat hitched on a nail.
sentences.chinese: 他的上衣被钉子钩住了。

sentences.english: A little monkey with two feet firmly hooked branches, upside down.
sentences.chinese: 一只小猴子用两只脚紧紧钩住了树枝，倒挂下来。

sentences.english: Her coat caught on the nail.
sentences.chinese: 她的大衣被钉子钩住了。

definition: to hook/to sew/to crochet/hook/check mark or tick/window catch
a hook/to make contact with sb
iron hook at the end a long pole
to detain/to hold back by force/to buckle/to hook
